description: Reconfiguration of drive thru lane and car park with associated works; alterations to elevations to include replacement drive thru booths, with glass canopies and new Trespa cladding and associated works to the site; installation of additional goal post height restrictors; and installation of six bicycle parking spaces.
subdivision_of_building: Rear and side elevations - ground floor.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): 0912-0484-01 Rev A (Location Plan), 0912-0484-03 Rev C (Existing Site Plan), P21-50-0484-05 Rev D (Existing & Proposed External Elevations), P21-50-0484-06 Rev H (Existing & Proposed General Arrangement Plan), P21-50-0484-300 Rev E (Proposed Site Plan), P21-50-0484-02 Rev C (Block Plan), 116476 Rev Issue 01 - 16/11/2021 (Sign 01 - Single Post sign - Qty 01no), 87779A Rev 2 (Sign 2 - FG-MCD-525), 11358-AEW-XXXX-SK01 (Reconnect Screen Details), 98748A Rev 1 (ERDDS Banner Sign), Height Restriction Goal post, Cover letter prepared by Planware dated 12/07/2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| Cycle storage for 6 bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| During construction works, no construction vehicles shall park, wait, load or unload on the footway/carriageway of the A312 or A40 at any time. No skip/construction material shall be kept on the public highway at all times.

Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies T1, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
